website_summaries.verdict: The Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex Desk is the largest single-volume external hard drive on the market and has arguably the best combination of design, performance, and storage capacity.
pros: The Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex Desk offers the highest capacity to date among single-volume external storage devices on the market
The drive comes in a flexible design that makes adding more connections/features a snap
cons: Out of the box, the Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex Desk has only a USB 2.0 connection
The drive topples easily when used in the intended vertical position, and it runs rather hot

customer_reviews.title: Failed after only two and a half years of light use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased July 3, 2012 and on April 23, 2015, it failed. Several emails were sent to Seagate asking for advice on a possible solution to this registered product to which I received ZERO replies. I eventually had to take the failed drive to an independent data recovery service who managed to rescue my backup files from this backup drive for their requisite exorbitant fee (aka ransom). I'll likely not buy another Seagate product if I can at all help it. I have HDDs from the early 90s by other manufacturers that are still perfectly serviceable to this day. Seagate: "reliability" is not thy name.
customer_reviews.author: Jace11

customer_reviews.title: Great External Drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in lieu of replacing one of my internal drives with something larger. Initially it was going to store all my media files and just be put to rest but then I found myself leaving it attached to my computer more often then not. With older external drives that I have, that are powered externally (from an outlet) I found that they would continue running even when not attached to a computer via USB and after the computer had been shut off or put into sleep/hibernation. This drive automatically powers up and down with the computer which I really like. It didn't try and install unnecessary software on my computer either and aesthetically it's quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: TravellingFool

customer_reviews.title: Good -- so far
customer_reviews.text: I have heard horror stories about Seagate hard drives. I have owned drives from all the manufacturers over the years and have not experienced Seagates being any more problematic than any others. Seagates have failed me as have Toshibas, Western Digitals, and Maxtors. At the same time, some drives from all these manufacturers have also lasted me for many years. I've only had this drive for a couple of months, but the price was right and the reviews good so far. The drive worked immediately, did what I asked it to do, and has contiued to do so. I have no complaints and will deal with issues when they come.
customer_reviews.author: BBA

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine With Mac
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 2TB version and it's been working fine connected to a Mac. It's on all day, every day. First thing out of the box I reformatted it using Mac Disk Utility. I partitioned it to use for two different backup applications: one which makes a complete "cloned" drive backup copy, and Apple's Time Machine for incremental data backups. Best feature (in my opinion) is how quiet this drive is compared to my older Seagate FreeAgent hard drives I have. It would be nice if there was some sort of indicator light just so I know it's on. Price was good. I'll probably buy another soon. Hope you find this helpful.
customer_reviews.author: R.Reinhart

customer_reviews.title: A really good Hard Drive at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Over a year ago I ordered an external Hard Drive from Techforless and it did not work so I sent it back and the replacement they sent to me did not work either. I have spent almost a year teying to get my money refunded and still have not gotten it. When I ordered the Seagate hard drive I got it right away and it has worked great giving me no problems at all. The price of the 1.5 TB was even less than what techforless charged me for an 750 Gb hard drive that did not work. I would tell everyone of my friends to buy this product if they want a good product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: ASH

customer_reviews.title: Seagate freeAgent Go Flex Desk 1.5 TB USB 2.0 External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: One of the smarter moves I have made. This back-up hard drive has 1.5 TB. and probably has more space than I will ever need. Very reasonable price around $80.00 bucks in 2012 when I bought it. It automatically backs up your computer files, pictures etc. and I've even managed to get upgrades for as little as $30.00. Still going strong with a long life expectancy. Check it out and I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex 1TB External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex 1TB Hard Drive when I ran out of space on an older external drive; I dual boot two 1TB Seagate internal drives with two different operating systems, and although I don't expect to really have over 1TB between them both, I do like to keep them adequately backed up with system images along with everything else. I don't use the software included with this drive; I prefer to use my Windows system. I got this drive recently on sale. I would recommend it highly for anyone who needs lots of storage for their files and system images.
customer_reviews.author: Granimals70Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Bad firmware, not software
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the Seagate software crap. Reformat the drive and just use it as a normal external hard drive without all the proprietary crap Seagate installed on the drive. The one problem I have is the drive loves to shut itself off to save power which is fine and dandy except it doesn't start back up when I use it again, so I have to unplug and replug it every time which is a huge pain in the butt. I'll be taking the 3.5" HDD out of this guy and putting it into my new NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: the drive is stored in the original box in a cool place. So far
customer_reviews.text: Purchased drive to store RAW images of photos. When not in use, the drive is stored in the original box in a cool place. So far, the drive has performed as expected. No issues with bad sectors or disk read errors. Drive is at 80% utilization. I have not noticed any slowness issues or drop in disk read/writes.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up for durability!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2012, and it is still working great for me. I've changed laptops several times, but the external hard drive has stayed the same. Yes, I have to plug it - unlike more updated versions. But for its durability, it was worth what I had spent on it 6 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first external hard drive purchase, and so far I have not had any problems accessing or copying to this one. I just opened the box, plugged it in the wall, hooked up the USB cable and seconds later I was copying files over and backing up my photos and videos. It comes packaged with some software, but I haven't taken a look at them. I just use some free back-up software I downloaded. At the time I purchased it, the price was $100, which was pretty good for the 1.5 TB. Like all electronics, I know this will seem ridiculously expensive in a few months, but what can you do?
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iMac
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning my 21.5 inch iMac can not mount the disk, but after reformatting using the disk utility it works perfectly. I seen lots of reviews saying that it mount and unmount repeatedly so I have been watching it closely since it came, but it has been 2 days and it works great. Nothing as the sort in the bad reviews. I cut out 1TB of space for time machine and use the rest for normal storage. I am really happy with this. and the price is the best among the TB-capacity hard drive in the market.
customer_reviews.author: p140748

customer_reviews.title: Second Seagate Drive that died
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this as many years ago, I had another Seagate drive that died on me. This one had a much shorter shelf life, 3 months! This just literally stopped working. I didn't drop it, nothing changed. It just sat on my desk and one day, it's icon disappeared off of my computer desktop and started making odd sounds. I have yet to return it as I am trying to see if I can at least recover my data. I would never purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Works for the Mac, but use Firewire.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the FreeAgent 2 TB USB 2.0 for my Mac tower as a Time Machine disk (the box said "USB 3.0 compatible", whatever that means). The disk kept disconnecting and freezing. Since I had access to Firewire 800, I purchased the Firewire 800 adaptor ($40) and have not had any problems for the past two months. I've copied about 1TB of data to it already, and I have not had any disconnects or data corruption issues. Operation is quiet and transfers speeds are as expected of the Firewire 800. So far this product is functioning as advertised. I have not tested it with a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Tinker 2

customer_reviews.title: Heavyweight drive for a lightweight price
customer_reviews.text: The drive is very responsive, no compatibility issues that I've seen with Vista or Win 7. Setup is easy, it does load a driver, which enables the backup program which comes with the drive. You don't need to install the software that comes with the drive (it's on the drive itself) if you don't need it, you can just use it as is. The on/off switch is a little difficult to depress, which is a very minor issue. Lots of space at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Year 5 - Still good.
customer_reviews.text: Entering year 5 and still running smooth. Device is almost full, about 120 GB left. So now it may be time to expand. Set up was easy. At first, I used the backup software, but last year I built a new computer and didn't set up the backup. I suppose I should. Update 6/23/20: Now on year 9! Still working good, but getting a little concerned that it may soon crash. I'm starting to shop around for something new.
customer_reviews.author: Neil R. Vig

customer_reviews.title: Nice disk - even for nonWinMackies
customer_reviews.text: I use 2 of these drives for my Linux systems. I keep one drive at home and one at work - and switch them weekly. I've abandoned all preformatted stuff and put an encrypted file system on each of them (Ext3 or Ext 4). That way my data is safe from fires (home and work locations) and priers (password). I use back-in-time for backing up, but I guess there are many options there. The drives work flawlessly. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: AndyG

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: So far i haven't had any issues with this hard drive. Overall, i've always been a fan of Seagate drives so If you're in the market for a hard drive, i'd definitely consider this one. It's a little bit big but I use it as a time machine backup, so the size doesn't really matter too much. The speed is decent, it's not any faster/slower than what I've been used to. The price was incomparable so on that alone, I'd recommend it to other users interested in a good hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: DayumWright

customer_reviews.title: Feelong secure about my backup.
customer_reviews.text: After going on three years, this device, managed by the included backup software, keeps my desktop backed up on-the-fly. Both users. I also plug in my laptop from time to time (though I have cloud backup) and use Windows 7 Backup to back up the laptop. It has no problem using both programs, and it has more than enough room for the data and photos on both, including a system image. recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Scott

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fast easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This drive is so quite its hard to know if its on. Very fast and Iv only had this for a few weeks but I always like Seagte as my last Seagate drive has lasted 2 years and is still working well. The only issue I had was with Windows7 Home Pro. If you try to connect 2 external hard drives at the same time you have to tell Windows 7 what letter you want for this new drive as the dumb windows 7 wont pick one for you. Very easy to do and once done all works well.
customer_reviews.author: Simon H

customer_reviews.title: So far so good especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I must be upfront but I only bought this drive to use as a backup. I simple use the backup and restore function in Windows 7. With that being said, the drive was simply plug and play. I literally just took it out of the box and plugged it into my desktop and configured the Windows backup and restore and was finished. The footprint of the drive is pretty small and it is reasonably quiet. For the price of $69 for 1TB, I don't think you can really go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Hoppaguy

customer_reviews.title: Bought three, no failures so far...
customer_reviews.text: All three seem to be working fine. Yes, they run rather hot, and are not silent, but I expected both of those attributes. While they run hot, they aren't so hot as to be uncomfortable to pick up (as some of my drives have been). I haven't heard any clicking so far. All-in-all they seem great. Large capacity, reasonable speed (not gonna break any records) and no failures so far. Since someone asked, Windows 7 shows the drive capacity as 3,000,582,139,904 bytes, or 2.72 TB.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This slick small / monster external harddrive it's a powerful piece of work. This drive had a very easy setup and the process started automatically and it only to about 20 mins total from setup to processing every inch of my computer on it. It was very quiet. Easy to find your files and belonging in case u wanted to remove or delete. I recommend if u just want to use for personal backup for your computer. Also I didn't hate tons of files or data either sO that could be some what of a reason y downloading didn't take much time !!
customer_reviews.author: MsBetty

customer_reviews.title: Gold Box Deal of the Day Win
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get this at a steal a few months ago. No issues, and does exactly what it is supposed to. Pros: Small profile Large amount of memory Easy backup sync with Win7/Win8 Speed works well if you have a USB 2.0 Cons: I know most have a separate power source, but I still don't like it. I think this is a great product, and I haven't had any issues with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: RBrandon

customer_reviews.title: this was a great price for the time I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I use this for Time Machine, with two partitions, so I can store files separate from the backups. Built to last, it's fast, quiet and hasn't failed me yet. Only downside for me is the need of a power cord (meaning I can't use it on the go). There are newer models now that don't require one and are well over 4 or 5 TB. Still, this was a great price for the time I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer and I bought this so that I could store all my raw files. I totally relied on it working well for many many years. How wrong I was.. It worked great for a couple of years, but for some reason it just stop working completely. I have all my work on this f'n external drive. I will never buy another Sea Gate product again..
customer_reviews.author: Tammy DeLaRosa

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this hard drive for movie storage and playback for over a year with zero problems. I got tired of having to sift through my DVD collection, so I ripped my disks and stored them here for ease of access as well as a backup. There is plenty of storage space and the drive has given me no problems. While it has almost-daily use, it is light use as it is really only used for storing and playing movie files.
customer_reviews.author: A. Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely  with the  Firewire-800 adapter, but occasionally forgets to remount a partition on the Mac
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this disk with a [...]Firewire 800 adaptor in an iMac, for backup and bootable clones of two machines. I have 5 partitions on it, one of them used for Time-machine backup. Occasionally this partition fails to automount after the computer wakes from sleep. All the other partitions stay mounted. One solution for this is to keep a terminal window open in the folder /Volumes/Time-machine, but Seagate should provide a firmware update to prevent this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Great with Firewire 800 adapter kit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 1TB version from Amazon with the Firewire 800 adapter base. The combination is quite good indeed. Transfer speeds are awesome! A little top heavy but it's really a non issue for this user. I placed a small velcro stip on the bottom and it stays right in place. This is a great unit if you want a firewire 800 drive but don't want to buy a Mac version and then reformat it. You'll like this one from Seagate.
customer_reviews.author: SkallyWag

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Had one, the same kind go bad on me, just crashed and stopped working, lost everything, then got a new one, and then it works and doesn't work when it feels like it. Poor QC.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Knudson

customer_reviews.title: Bulky fragile and just terrible
customer_reviews.text: One day the cord accidently got pulled out while in use and it's be unresponsive ever since Talk about a waste. Not to mention all my information gone in a second
customer_reviews.author: champion rings

customer_reviews.title: Good external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I always scour the reviews of hard drives before I buy one so I figure I should contribute my experience as well. I have had this about 8 months and have experienced no problems with it on either Windows XP Pro or Windows 7 Ultimate. As others have noted an on\off switch would be nice as I use this for back up and only turn it on when I need it. I'd certainly recommend or buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Myles

customer_reviews.title: Great price for all that storage!
customer_reviews.text: This unit has more storage than I will probably ever use. It's sort of like the guy who has so much stuff he has to go rent a storage facility to hold all his stuff. I figure if I don't have room for it, I don't need it anymore. But it is so nice to be able to back up all my laptop, iPod's and desktop computers to one place!!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a great external hard disk, I have been using it for many months, possibly over a year. The USB connection is quite fast, it is my fastest external hard drive. It is still too slow, but my MacBook Pro doesn't support USB 3.0 so I think this is the best I can do. Unless I want to shell out for a Thunderbolt drive.
customer_reviews.author: Tropylium

customer_reviews.title: SEAGATE STAC1500100 FreeAgent GoFlex Desk 1.5 TB USB 2.0 External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I recieved a very good price from Amazon on this unit. Upon arrival, I read the quick guide for setup and wal-ah. It expediently back my files us from my hard drive and that is using the 2.0 USB. The unit is also very stylish sitting on my desk. I have had no problems from this unit. I liked it so much that I bought a Seagate Barracuda, 1TB 7200 rpm, 32cache internal hard drive to coinside with this unit. Now, I have a generous amount of space-backed up.
customer_reviews.author: Dspl4Js

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a week ago it works as expected. No complaints so far. If you are transferring data from a computer with USB 2.0 it is really fast-relatively slower when transferring from older computers. For this price it is an awesome storage device and mind you lot of space too. The fact that even after emptying my old laptop's hard drive into this there is still more than 1 TB space remaining-which just pleases me. I am a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: rpluss

customer_reviews.title: Got a Clue?
customer_reviews.text: There is very little help with this product. The old 500GB glo flex was great. This is seemingly great but I cannot figure out how to view the backed-up files. There are no directions and I have no clue. In the 500 GB it goes through backup and you can see them and copy them onto another computer. With this Desk 2.0 TB model, no such luck. You click on view files and eventually nothing. HELP.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent External Drive
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this external drive in both functionality and price. I like the thought of being able to upgrade my connection between the drive and computer to USB 3.0 when I change computers. The only thing I didn't care for was the loaded software for backup that came with the drive. There was limited FAQs with the online service having no documentation at all of the features and how to use it. I wiped the software from the drive and now use MozyHome to backup my files locally and online. Mozy and this drive are the perfect combination.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Avery

customer_reviews.title: So far it's working like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the 1.5 TB drive for a little over a month and a half now, and it's been working flawlessly. Excellent price, and I love the option to upgrade the base to USB 3.0 (probably my favorite feature). I would recommend this external hard drive to anyone. It looks great, so far works great, and the upgradability is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H.

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Free Agent GoFlex Desk 1.5 TB USB Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I didn't test the Windows stuff on it as I bought it so I could install Ubuntu precise (Linux OS) so I repartitioned it to make some ext3 partitions for Linux. I still have Windows on my notebook's internal drive. This lets me dual boot Ubuntu or Windows. The drive works great and when i use Ubuntu i get more space since Windows uses more overhead for its file system than Linux file systems. I didn't have to wait for a driver to be installed in Ubuntu as most hardware can be used 'out of the box' these days unlike Windows which i had to wait a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve 7233

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for automatic backups!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using this drive to back up my desktop at home. The software package stays up to date, so everything on your computer is safely copied. It is actually a little too efficient, so I will unplug it from the usb for a few days at a time, and then it will backup all the new data as soon as I plug it back in.
customer_reviews.author: JD Lovil

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - High failure rate reported do your research before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working within 11 months of use. Used it to backup files on 5 occasions, no longer responding. purchased a replacement usb adapter/power supply unit, will power for 10 seconds and then die. I have about 1.5tb if data that has been lost. Happy I have pictures backed up on multiple drives. But I did lose 75% percent of my music collection due to the fact that I transferred all of my music to the hard drive and gave away my cd's and albums (yes I did say albums).
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Horne

customer_reviews.title: Modular design make this the best choice for Mac users.
customer_reviews.text: I was in a bind and needed extra storage but could not afford a drive with a Firewire or Thunderbolt interface for decent transfer speeds. Even though this is USB 2.0 you can easily switch the interface out at a later time making this drive a great choice for those who can foresee the need to upgrade in the future.
customer_reviews.author: candotude

customer_reviews.title: "Amazon Verified Purchase,"
customer_reviews.text: I could not be without this product. Easy to install and use. The price is right. Loads of space. Is a great back up for all your files. If you take many pictures this has to space to keep them or back them up. Stands upright and takes up very little space in your work area. A must buy for the protection of you computer data.
customer_reviews.author: Bennie in PA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews listed here are downright curious -- inaccurate to say the least or maybe that's just how convoluted Windows is these days. We are a Mac household. It's so much easier... My Mac installation routine lasted all of 10 seconds...asked me if I wanted to use it with Time Machine? Yes. Bam. Done. Works perfectly. Period.
customer_reviews.author: MyOnlineOpinions

customer_reviews.title: Not for Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: I was real dissapointed to discover this drive is not compatible with Windows 8. Installed seamlessly onto my laptop that runs Vista and my other desktop running XP. Be careful the product description does not state the restriction (that I could find).
customer_reviews.author: BJM

customer_reviews.title: New replacement Extrenal Hard-Drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Seagate Unit to replace the other name brand external hard-drive. The old unit had been replaced 3 times and I wanted to replace it with a more reliable brand drive. I have always had good luck with Seagate drives in the past and felt that the Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex Desk 3 TB USB 2.0 External Hard Drive would be a great unit to get.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Smith Sr

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was my backup drive for about a year, when it failed unexpectedly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lippeatt

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: After using this drive for a few months, I highly recommend it. I use the USB 2.0 and the speed is consistent with 2.0. My only negative is that there is no on-off switch. Once plugged in to the computer port, the drive is powered and is recognized on the desktop. I use this as my main hard drive backup using Super Duper for OSX.
customer_reviews.author: Arn

customer_reviews.title: More-MOre-MORE Storage on the Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Needed to add storage to my Mac Pro. Seagate has not released internal 3TB drives. Amazon released bargain price 3TB Seagate external drives. I found a winner. Bought 4 units, extracted the hard drives for my Mac Pro and sold the USB cases for a little. Winning deal for everyone and Amazon is a great place to pick up great deals. Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mehrman53

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Seagate is my preferred HDD company. I have yet to get a faulty drive from them. However this thing is unstable standing up. With the disk spinning it falls over very easily. I have 3 kids and 2 cats, and I have to have this thing lay on it's side, because it ends up there most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Arlack

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product!  Never worked ONCE!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this hard drive right when I got it and it never worked once. When I clicked on it a message would pop up and say, "Location not available. The device is not ready." A complete waste of money, as I can't even access the drive. I tried contacting the company and never got a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Skittlegirl

customer_reviews.title: Seagate drive.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Seagate drive with which I have had a problem. Not quite sure what it was, but my computer faied to recognize it. I have several hard drives (various manufacturers) and did not experience the problem with the others. Spent half a day trying to resolve the issue. Eventually went to Seagates website which is not easy to navigate,Threw my hands in the air and returned it to Amazon. For the record: I rarely write reviews when things work perfectly. Only when I have problems.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela I. Widmer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: It's a little heavy and it needs to be plugged in to an outlet, but it was the amazon deal of the day when I bought it, and it works well. I constantly write and re-write to it about 1TB a day. It's been about a year since I've had it and have had no issues. Great product so far!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth W

customer_reviews.title: Neat, sleek works very well
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, it's easy to use, I love the look and design of it. It is fast, does what it is supposed to and plays nice over multiple platforms. I feel confident that I would be using this for a very long time and recommend it to anyone looking for external storage.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Felix

customer_reviews.title: Seagate not a good hard drive and service is very bad
customer_reviews.text: Seagate not a good hard drive and service is very bad
customer_reviews.author: alwayson

customer_reviews.title: MEGA SPACE SAVER
customer_reviews.text: I got this Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex external because my Iomega was running out of space and I needed a hard drive that was interchangeable between my MacBook Pro and PC. This drive not only do that but also allowed me to setup dedicated storage for to backup my MacBook Pro Time Machine. I think I'm going to get another Seagate GoFlex portable for my travel and go around drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bascho-George (BG)

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable drive, randomly disconnects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these drives this summer. Immediately after setting it up, I started having problems with it making clicking noises and randomly powering down then back up (effectively disconnecting). I contacted Seagate support about it, and, after giving me a bit of a run-around, eventually agreed to replace it for me. After waiting almost three months for my replacement to arrive, when it came, the replacement did the exact same thing as the original: made clicking noises and randomly disconnects. I have had good experience with Seagate in the past, but I do not trust this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: David Correll

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Being a bit of a video freak, the HDD on my laptop fills up fast. This was simple to install, plug it in, run the disk, you're in business. Data transfer is quick and simple, video runs just as smooth as it did from the internal. I cannot recommend this enough. Not only met my expectations, it exceeds them. If you have the need for exterior storage capacity, this unit will serve you well in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Seagate GoFlex 2TB HDD
customer_reviews.text: This is the second such purchase of this product that I have recently acquired. The product works well, though the Memeo software provided is very basic especially compared to something like Retrospect. The upgrade to Memeo Premium is over priced and lacks a lot of desired features. The GoFlex product enables the use of a USB 3.0 adapter which is a definite long term plus. I have previously used Western Digital Drives that did not have the desired long-term reliability. Only time will tell if the Segates were a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: martychgo

customer_reviews.title: Such a Great Drive, I ordered TWO!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these drives connected to my macs and have not had any issues whatsoever! They never fail to mount, are quite and even though the speed could be a bit faster, Overall, I'm quite happy with these units. I noticed Seagate recently released a newer version specifically designed for Macs that run about $100 more. The only difference I can tell is they added a firewire port and the drive is pre-formatted for a mac out of the box. To each their own but I'd rather save the $$$ and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: MJETER

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and execution!
customer_reviews.text: This hard-drive had done me well. I've had two of them for a year and a half and neither has failed. It also saves you money as buying the attachment with a firewire connection only has to be done once where as you can pay up the a$$ for that on other hard-drives. Great job seagate!
customer_reviews.author: Z. Mehrbach

customer_reviews.title: On the go with 1TB drive
customer_reviews.text: this is the most exciting hard drive I have ever connected to my system! I can't imagine ever filling this drive up but the fact that I am now able to do a full system backup on a regular basis is very good thing to have... I was able to hook it up in seconds run the install of the backup software and done. now my system is doing full system backups round the clock. The speed of the drive along with its portability makes this a must have in my book.
customer_reviews.author: The  "Wizard"

customer_reviews.title: 2TB Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the best back-up investments I made for my computer. I've had it for 2 years now and it still works perfect. I don't have it plugged in all the time but maybe 2-3 times a week. Have taken it on 2 overseas flights and back and have no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for two reasons. The first is that I was reformatting some HDDs and didn't have anything with enough size to backup my data before wiping and reformatting. The second was to have a backup for all of my data. Pros: - This was the definition of plug and play - One time quick setup, including automatic backups, and I haven't had to touch it since Cons: - None
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: GoFlex Is the Best Value
customer_reviews.text: This GoFlex 3 TB drive is everything it advertise to be. It runs completely quiet. It is as fast as an internal hard drive. When your computer goes to sleep it does also. Works perfectly with Windows 7. I am a completely satisfied customer and I highly recommend you buy this GoFlex 3 TB drive from Amazon. WHY? They have the best price and the fastest delivery I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seagate FreeAgent 2 TB
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this drive for about a week. The setup was straightforward and easy. It is automatically backing up my files. My primary need is to back some files and lots of pics and videos of the family. It does that well. I've been pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice storage unit!
customer_reviews.text: I've really liked this external drive. It's easy to use and has huge storage. I manually back up my system, but I'm probably going to order another to do a ghost image of my whole hard drive. So far, no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Madam M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: High capacity, works as planned, handy back up for data.
customer_reviews.author: D R Bird

customer_reviews.title: this usb will work with out you doing anything
customer_reviews.text: this USB will work with out you doing anything,fast,and very qouiet no noise it all,highly rocoumend it to anyone,i am very bad on computer ,and this one work with out me doing anything except ploging the usb to the loptop,amazon gave me 2 days shipping thanks amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tamaiev

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Everyone makes a mistake once in a while when ordering things. Turned out to be a complete waste of money. This drive lasted only lasted two months and I lost all of the data on it. Luckily I keep copies.
customer_reviews.author: truman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Saver
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something to save picuters and music on from my computer, and it does just that. Shortly after buying it, my PC crashed. If it weren't for the moving them to this, they would have all been lost. It will be a long time until this is full.
customer_reviews.author: Rickgum

customer_reviews.title: Great disk
customer_reviews.text: I use this disk to attach to a satellite receiver to convert it into a DVR. I copied the included software so I could convert it back someday. Installation went fast and it has a great capacity. You can convert it to USB 3.0 with a different base.
customer_reviews.author: Len E. Laclair

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice external hard drive; probably more space on this one than I'll need, but I'm very pleased with it. Very sleek & stylish as well as lightweight. I like the idea that it has it's own power source. It suits my purpose for an extenal hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Rozzi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive is the best I have ever purchased. Simply plug it in and start adding files. I also bought the alternate base that allows for Firewire connection, and it had two Mac style ports so I can 'daisy chain' my external drives. Way to go Seagate!
customer_reviews.author: James G. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: This one is one of the most economical hard drive out there. I have two of them connected on the same computer running Windows Xp. They were recognized at the same time with two letters assigned. I can use one to back up the other manually. No problem at all. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nash

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I received Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex Desk 3 TB USB 2.0 External Hard Drive STAC3000100 (Black) on time. This HD gives a formatted space of 2.72 TB . I am happy that I got this product at only $129. The current price of this product is way too higher. Initially i had driver problem because i had installed 64 bit OS on Dell vostro 1015. Overall the HD is a good buy. So far this has worked fine.The only hitch could be, it needs a power supply , it doesnt draw power from PC or laptop. The drive doesnt get too hot when in use. I would recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Akki

customer_reviews.title: a great hard drive
customer_reviews.text: i need to get this hard drive because i have a pc laptop and a macbook. it handles both with no problem. this is a great hard drive. it installs easy with no problems. i love it.
customer_reviews.author: D.J. M&M

customer_reviews.title: Great Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Have really enjoyed using this hard drive to back up my computer hard drive. The drive was delivered fast by Amazon and I have had no problems with it. Would recommend this drive and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Coonass

customer_reviews.title: Worth evr'y penny!
customer_reviews.text: I've got sick & tired of losing my files every time I had any problem with my pc. Thus I decided to have an external HD and this one satisfied all my needs. delivered way before schedulled date and works perfectly, great buy!
customer_reviews.author: RAMSÉS ROBERTO RUZISCKA Just fantastic  to go back to our  ancestors!

customer_reviews.title: NAS rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Network attached storage changed my life. My files are in a central location and are so much more organized now. Build quality is good and the speed is sufficient for my needs. I can also use it as a portable backup solution when I'm in a pinch. No problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Xiochi

customer_reviews.title: Ok, except for the software.
customer_reviews.text: This seems a fine piece of gear, but the Backup Software with it is some of the most intrusive,consumer unfriendly/demanding I've ever seen. It kept asking me to add services I didn't want and eventually I just wiped the drive and reformatted. I understand the need to find ways to sell your ancilliary products and software, but how many times do I have to refuse before you (and your software) get the point. Please...offer the program in at least two forms - functional and quiet or hard sell and obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: great with a few kinks.......
customer_reviews.text: So i would have to say this is a great product. The hard drive space is awesome. I have moved thousands of photos, home videos and scanned documents and still good on space. The one and only downside to this great product is the fact that it loses connection and will not show visible on your pc. This usually occurs when you try to connect to a home network. It makes it hard to stream files over wifi. That is my biggest concern now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Totally awesome deal!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend as a birthday gift and he loves it! It is everything it should be, it performs perfectly and the price was way better than comparable models. No complaints at all :)
customer_reviews.author: dylannsmom

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEAL. GOOD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for $80-85 which is an unbeatable price for a 2TB. The harddrive is pretty fast. The only thing I didn't know when I bought this item is that it needs its own power source. Still, 5 stars! I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Big Storage at a Low Price
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see a 3TB drive for this price, and a SeaGate no less. I needed something better than the 1-1/2TB NAS Drive I had to back up all of my music and movies. This is the perfect unit. With the Firewire adapter the Time Machine backups are lightening fast on my Mac. Item arrived fast too. Very satisfied with this item, even though it quietly sits in the background keeping all my files backed up and safe.
customer_reviews.author: PixelRat

customer_reviews.title: storage for DVR
customer_reviews.text: Bought to store movies from my DVR, works great, have tons of room as I have a 250GB drive on my DVR so am very pleased with it. Is fast enough to play the movies right off of the external drive.
customer_reviews.author: arcy

customer_reviews.title: Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex Ex Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Drive seems to be working well. I was "very" "Very" dissapointed with the enclosed written instructions. Almost nonexistant. I have a Mac computer and wasn't aware I had to change the format to Mac OS Extended (Journaled). Instructions pretty much state plug it in and go!! Finaly found out what I needed to do through the Apple forum.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: I love that it has the stand attached
customer_reviews.text: I love that it has the stand attached, and it's pretty sleek and fits on my desk discreetly. No issues on the operation of it, runs smooth!
customer_reviews.author: porcelaindoll

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not so simple to install and use
customer_reviews.text: I did have to download the drivers from internet, my computer did not recognize the device, so I had to install it manually. Sometimes the drive is not available in the explorer, soI have to manually name it to access it.
customer_reviews.author: PabloRodCam

customer_reviews.title: Used with Macs
customer_reviews.text: Great drive that still runs. It's a little slow when it first wakes up but otherwise, great storage. I use it with my Macs.
customer_reviews.author: MinhcallaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect to my computer...I will lost all my files
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2TB Seagate goflex external hard drive. One day it didn't connect to my computer. I can't see drive E on list of my computer. It also made noise. I have a lot of files and photos in this external hard drive that need to backup.
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: A Good Backup Solution for a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it short - a good product that works as advertised for a good price. My only issue is that it does not give me quite the control I would prefer in my backup options - like it will not let me schedule backups to run at certain times and it will not let me do incremental or revision-ed backups that I have found. These complaints are really about the software that ships with it though, and not the device itself. There are other software solutions that can provide that if needed. So, overall, good and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Using this as media hard drive a blast!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as with all the I-Tunes tv shows videos and movies all our hard drive space was becomming small and we have shelves of dvds some stored in boxes under our bad. Now we have our own movies on demand right at home.
customer_reviews.author: Partsman

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Storage Device
customer_reviews.text: Item is quiet when running and provides ample storage space. Had this item for about three years without any problems
customer_reviews.author: sean c riggs

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this hard drive
customer_reviews.text: after 6 months I own this hard drive, one day it start making weird noises and next thing I knew my computer or any other computer I tried could not recognize the hard drive. So save your data and your time and buy another hard drive. Although the hard drive had two years warranty, the returning procedure is not easy and of course I will have to pay the shipping cost and then hope that the replacement hard drive won't be also defective. I won't buy Seagate again.
customer_reviews.author: vasso

customer_reviews.title: Screwing deployed soldiers
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive worked perfectly for about 3 days just long enough for me to get pictures and movies stored on it. Luckily I had all my pictures saved on other devices or I would have lost everything. After 3 days the hard drive started making a beeping sound and my computer would no longer recognize it. I cant return it to the manufacturer do to the fact I am currently deployed to Afghanistan. I would not recommend this product to anyone who wants a reliable device and I will pass it on to my supply chain not to trust anything this company makes.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great spare drive and fantastic backup software.
customer_reviews.text: Great spare drive with very useful backup software. Large capacity for all my storage needs. Feel safe knowing my files are there and backed up when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: William Eid

customer_reviews.title: BULKY BUT OK
customer_reviews.text: Kind of bulky; battery easily falls off but does its job.
customer_reviews.author: HollisHoHo

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Never could get it to work... need to resell it.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L.

product_meta.title: Seagate FreeAgent GoFlex Desk 1 TB USB 2.0 External Hard Drive STAC1000100 (Black)
product_meta.description:
Capacity:1 TB1TB USB2.0 freeagent goflex desk

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The GoFlex™ Desk external drive delivers high-capacity storage, backup and encryption for all your files with its plug-and-play USB 2.0 connectivity. You now have versatile connection options to suit your needs. Simply pair the drive with a USB 3.0 or FireWire® 800/USB 2.0 GoFlex Desk desktop adapter and instantly increase your performance by up to 10x. The GoFlex Desk drive works interchangeably between a PC and Mac® computer and can be set in either a vertical or horizontal orientation, complementing any desktop environment. 



Seagate® GoFlex™ Desk PROTECT. STORE. DO MORE. 
Highlights  * Easy - Plug-and-play external hard drive with automatic backup software
 * Compatible - Share files with both PC AND MAC 
 * Flexible - Optional connectors deliver increased performance beyond USB 2.0


Easy - Plug-and-play external hard drive with automatic backup software  * Ensures automatic continuous backup of your data
 * Secures your backed up files and protects your privacy with powerful encryption software
 * Includes the Seagate® Dashboard management tool for easy management of backup schedules, file encryption, and at-a-glance drive statistics, including available capacity
 * Offers vertical or horizontal orientation to fit in any desktop environment 



Compatible - Share files with both PC and Mac  * Whether you have a PC or a Mac® computer-or if you go back and forth between the two-you can access and save files on the same portable hard drive anytime without reformatting*.


*Reformatting to HFS+ required to use backup software for Mac or Time Machine® software 

Flexible - Optional connectors deliver increased performance beyond USB 2.0 USB 2.0 (Included) Firewire™ eSATA USB 3.0  * Offers upgrade cables and kits that make it easy to move up from USB 2.0 to USB 3.0, eSATA or FireWire® 800 for up to 10x faster transfer speeds for your large files and HD movies
 * Extends your digital life so you can access and share your files from anywhere by pairing your drive with the GoFlex Net media sharing device
 * View your movies and photos on your TV by pairing your drive with the GoFlex TV HD media player



What can you store? Capacity Digital Music
(Hours) Digital Photos
(Files) Digital Videos
(Hours) DVD Quality
(Movies) HD Video
(Hours) 1.0 TB 16,600 320,000 1,000 250 250 2.0 TB 33,320 640,000 2,000 500 500 3.0 TB 49,980 960,000 3,000 750 750 Average file size using cameras highest resolution JPEG mode Based on standard 2 hour movie Based on H.264 compression at a 6.75Mbs bitrate 

The GoFlex™ Storage System 
Introducing the world's most versatile external hard drives. 

Seagate® GoFlex™ Family Hard Drives





GoFlex™ Ultra-Portable Drive  * Easy - Plug-and-play external hard drive with automatic backup software 
 * Compatible - Share files with both PC and Mac
 * Flexible - Optional connectors deliver increased performance beyond USB 2.0 and connect to TV and internet
 * Capacities: 320GB, 500GB, 750GB, 1TB

GoFlex™ Pro™  * Easy - Plug-and-play 7200 rpm external hard drive with premium backup software

 * Capacities: 1TB, 2TB, 3TB

GoFlex™ Home  * Easy - Access files wirelessly when connected to a router

 * Flexible - Automatic and continuous backup of up to three computers on your network
 * Capacities: 1TB, 2TB

Backup Easy Backup Software (pre-installed) Easy backup software automatically protects files and folders on your computer 

Media Connection Options 
GoFlex™ TV HD Media Playing Device * Easy - Play your movies, photos and music on your TV
 * Compatible - Supports 1080p/HDMI connection
 * Flexible - Internet connectivity/optional Wi-Fi adapter

GoFlex™ Net Media Sharing  * Easy - Share your content with friends and family
 * Compatible - Share files with both PC and Mac
 * Flexible - Access content from your iPhone, iPad or other portable devices

Wireless router sold separately 





GoFlex™ Desk Specifications 
System Requirements  * Windows® 7, Windows Vista®, Windows® XP (32-bit & 64-bit) operating system or
 * Operating system Max OS X 10.4.6 Tiger or higher, 10.5 Leopard or 10.6 Snow Leopard (the 32-bit kernel). Reformatting for Mac may be required.
 * USB 2.0 Port


Compatibility may vary depending on user's hardware configuration and operating system Product Dimensions 6.22in L x 4.88in W x 1.73in D (158mm x 124mm x 44mm) Weight: 2.38lb (1.08kg) Inside the Box  * GoFlex™ Desk external drive
 * Backup with encryption software pre-loaded on drive
 * NTFS driver for Mac® pre-loaded on drive
 * GoFlex™ Desk USB 2.0 adapter base with capacity gauge
 * 5-foot (150cm) USB 2.0 cable
 * Power Supply
 * Quick start guide
 * 2-year limited warranty
